Column Comment.0: WELL LOG DICTIONARY: The dictionary contains a set of curve names, propertynames and parameters that are used by a well logging contracter during a specifiedperiod of time. At any given time, a contractor may have one or more dictionaries inuse.
Column Comment.1: PARAMETER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the parameter that is found in thedictionary.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: DESCRIPTION: a short narrative description about the parameter.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.6: MNEMONIC: mnemonic assigned to this parameter.
Column Comment.7: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.8: PREFERRED INDICATOR: For each parameter class, only one entry in eachdictionary should be set to preferred = Y. This allows the user to indicate whichparameter should be used by preference in each class, esp in the case where morethan one version of the parameter may exist.
Column Comment.9: PPDM QUANTITY: Contains the valid set of quantities that apply to a measurementsystem. Examples are, length, volume, and temperature.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SHORT NAME: Short version of the name given to this parameter.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
